title: Windows are the eyes to the sole proprietorship... or LLC
body: It's time to figure out what we're going to put in the big windows that, unfortunately, fall in the auditorium. I'm going to build the frames tonight, but I need to figure out what I want it to look like from the outside. Hmm, here's a few thoughts I've had. I like the disjointed feel one. It kind of gives the impression of a big sign that's been split in two. This one has a bit more pizzazz and khutzpah... but it also looks like chicken pox. I do, however, like the idea of painting the remaining part of the logo on the bricks (if we're given permission). A little "trompe l'oeil" never hurt anyone. Right? Well, excluding Willy Coyote. Hmm, I'm not sure what we have here... but I like it!
author: Dan

comments.author: Matt
comments.body:
being both a graphic designer and working for a large sign, vehicle wrap, and window vinyl company in the uk.. I'd definately say something along the lines of No2.

I REALLY like the continuation onto the brick, too many people have blind faith in theories so you ignore the fact that it actually stands out as something you dont see oten (for that reason) and actually looks good!

If you're concerned about keeping the colours consistent, rather than paint it, have the sign company make you a panel to fit in that gap (I would use foamex, dibond or aluminium), shaped to fix the lettering, and the same white and black vinyl applied to the face as used on the windows... it will still fade at a slightly different rate and look slightly different because I assume the others are internally applied behind the glass, but if you fix the panel straight to the brick, it would look nice and nifty and you wouldnt have to match paint to the vinyl shades...

2 definately would catch my attention anyway
